metadata.title: CVE-2017-18270 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 4.13.5, a local user could create keyrings forother users via keyctl commands, setting unwanted defaults or causing adenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18270` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-lowlatency - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1076-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1076.84
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1078.83
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1039-aws - 4.4.0-1039.48
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-4.13.0-26-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-26-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1009-kvm - 4.4.0-1009.14
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-98.121').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.84').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.83').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1039.48').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1009.14').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
